cons: I do not have much cons to report.

review_title: Decent opportunity for entry level applicants
cons: -Redundant workdays. -Pay does not match job requirements; for instance, they require applicants to have a Bachelor's degree, but they pay you less than $40,000/yr even though Enrollment Coordinators have more responsibilities than most of the other higher-paid job titles within the institution.

pros: Great opportunity to help provide a needed service to the military community.
cons: Small amount of opportunities within the organization to move up.

review_title: Overseas Culture is Challenging, but Decent Benefits
pros: Decent benefits! While base salary is relatively low, I also receive a housing allowance and a cost of living adjustment which ends up being around $20,000 on top of my base pay. I have more time off then I end of using, too!
cons: I've had challenging work environments while working overseas, it is a very tumultuous environment and we've had a lot of people leave and a lot of vacancies. There are many military dependents that are hired, which is wonderful, but they know their days are numbered so sometimes by the time a position opens at UMGC they only have a year before PCSing. Lots of turnover make the office culture tricky!
Admin will do nothing for you. You are entirely on your own. They know you can’t quit because you’re over seas and they take advantage of that. They lack compassion for employees

pros: You can get your degree and watch swampy entrenched people play king of the flies.
cons: They'll probably go down the same road as Uni of Phoenix at some point.

review_title: Good mission statement, great non-traditional education
job_title: Advanced Military Education Coordinator in Tokyo
pros: Gain valuable skills in multi-tasking, public speaking (in some positions), team management, and ultimately, sales. Good play to work for until you hit a cap on your own personal growth.
cons: Very little to no upward mobility unless you drink the kool-aid and commit for life while also shining the shoes of your superiors while waiting on them to retire.

pros:
I never bring work home, it pays well considering the low stress environment. 

I receive tuition remission so I am able to get my Masters for free, no strings attached.

It's an easy entry into the world of higher education.
cons: A lot of the same cases day to day. Lots of emailing and phone calling.

pros: If your single and want to travel then the Asian and European divisions might be worth your time. Teachers have been turned into production units and students are widgets. However, I enjoy my military students. There was always something going on in their world.
cons: The shifted from an education center management model to a business model in the hopes of beating Phoenix University at their game. This destroyed a lot of the quality of the program.

job_title: National Test Center Administrator in Okinawa
pros: I really enjoyed helping students reach their educational goals. I had wonderful coworkers. The pay was great. My supervisor was pretty good.
cons: Some people do not like to follow policy and procedures as they should. There are some people in upper management who showed favoritism to some and allowed them to do what they want to.

review_title: Lots of travel for UMUC locations abroad
pros: Team work, academic freedom,  challenging environment overseas, disciplined students but with widely varying background
cons: Heavy travel under new traveling faculty model, logistics still smoothed out, falling enrollment in some areas abroad

pros: The management gives you enough flexibility to show your skills. Plenty of ongoing training and opportunities for education.
cons: I can't describe any. Everything was great

job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Yokota, Tokyo
cons: Inconsistency.  Rules and operating procedures changed quickly without much reason.

pros: Good benefits, especially vacation time/sick time off.
cons: Long hours. 6 month probation period (no vacation days can be used). Not sure if this is still in practice.

review_title: Good place for a short stay...
cons: contract work, job is always temporary

pros: Wonderful place to work each day, team is focused on students.
cons: It is a very large campus.
